Class PrimersToTranscripts

  • java.lang.Object
    • PrimersToTranscripts

  • public class PrimersToTranscripts
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is to extracted the known transcripts which cover a pair of given primers for PCR.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PrimersToTranscripts(java.lang.String genome_file, java.lang.String anno_file)
      Please be aware we use ensembl's file where the coordinates start from one (1-based) while UCSC's coordinates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrimersToTranscripts

        public PrimersToTranscripts(java.lang.String genome_file,
                            java.lang.String anno_file)
        Please be aware we use ensembl's file where the coordinates start from one (1-based) while UCSC's coordinates. starts from zero (0-based)
        Parameters:
        genome_file - The genome fasta file in the format of "fa", "fasta", or "gz"
        anno_file - The annotation file that includes the information of genes. The format is GTF.

    • Method Detail

      • iterateAllTranscripts

        public void iterateAllTranscripts()

      • extractSeqInRegion

        public java.lang.String extractSeqInRegion(java.lang.String chr,
                                           int strand,
                                           int start_idx,
                                           int end_idx)
        Extract the dna sequence between start_idx(inclusive) and end_idx(inclusive) from a specific genome.
        Parameters:
        chr - chromosome
        strand - The strand for returning sequence and it can be either positive +1 or negative -1.
        start_idx - The location of the start.
        end_idx - The address of the end.
        Returns:
        seq A sequence in the specified region from reference genome.

      • extractAttribute

        public java.lang.String extractAttribute(java.lang.String search_str,
                                         java.lang.String keyword)

      • complementary

        public java.lang.String complementary(java.lang.String seq)
        Produce the complementary sequence for a given DNA sequence. The sequence is always from 5' to 3' therefore the returned sequence is reverse complment sequece. Some characters outside the scope of {A, C, T, G}, such {N, R, Y, S, W}, will be maintaining the same. The other unknown character will halt the program.
        Parameters:
        seq - A nucleotide that contains a string composited by {A, C, T, G}, case insensitive.
        Returns:
        reverse complementary sequence

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
